author: DrathMaul1997
title: Nice set...
review:
Overview 
Quite a nice little set for the price. 
The mini figure is, as the title suggests, a crash test dummy and comes with a large spanner, a number plate and a black base.

 The Mini figure 
The mini 'fig' is all over yellow with a black belt line, he also has black and yellow markings on his body, two on each leg, two on his chest and one on his forehead. There also seems to be a metal band on around his lower torso.

 The Accessories 
Spanner: Not much to say really apart from the fact that it is too big in my opinion.

Number plate: A white plate with PA7 70 on it.

Base: Well made look for 8683 on Brickset to see one

Over all 
A good set that would make a nice super villain if you have an old Batman or Spider man set
Â£1.50 would be a better price though

author: absolutelylez
title: Good but of little use
review: This figure is nicely designed and the printing is very good. The accessories are quite poor however and I see little way of using this figure in my actual Lego City, unless I design a special testing center for cars!

author: Jcc2224
title: Simulation is About to Begin!
review: This minifig, in my opinion, ROCKS! I love this minifig, mainly for his nice printing. But one crisis that FOL have been enduring for a few years now, CHEAP PLASTIC! They use this CP on Key chains, Magnets, and even in the collectible Minifigs now! But if you bypass that fact, it's a good minifig. The price, $1.99 USD, is a good one for a minifig. But I had to pay 'bout a dollar more because I didn't get them in time and had to buy them at Bricklink.com. Overall, accounting everything, 4/5.

author: brixton
title: The Auto Industry's Dummy
review: The Crash Test Dummy is an interesting mini-figure but my least favorite out of all the collectible mini-figures I have.  He looks exactly like a dummy being yellow all over and having the crash test logos on his head and body.  He comes with a license plate and a spanner.  If you are building a custom car and need a license plate for it then this set will come in handy.  The spanner is way too big for the dummy.

author: legofan3810
title: Lego's Crash Test Dummy
review:
This is a fairly decent set. There is not much playability to it unless you have lots of Lego cars. I would say this is one of the OK mini figures, not the worst, not the best, but OK.  If you're not a Lego car buyer, you would be pretty unlucky to get this set.


Pros
Cool fig
License plate
Stand
Realistic Detail

Cons
A bit expensive
Tool is HUGE



Overall, 4/5


My next review: Cargo Truck

author: Agreenbrick
title: Kind of good
review: A nice and unique minifigure, but tlc calls it "demolition dummy" instead of crash test dummy, wich is explained if you read the bios of this guy on the minifigures homepage. Overall kind of good, and so far I'm not dissapointed with the plastic!

author: legomaniac
title: The most abused of the minifigures
review:
I always wanted a LEGO crash test dummy even before the collectible figures came out.  Finally got one and I love him. Not sure why he has a wrench but ok. License plate can be used for a MOC and make a crash test scene for the figure.

     The quality is very good minus the leg quality. Printing is excellent, the facial expression seems silly to me and makes me smile. must be the caution sticker on his forehead :P

author: Brickmeister1138
title: Poor Buster...
review:
General Info: The demolition dummy is a well done figure, but his selection of parts is less than stellar, lacking even a single new part. This is especially noticable considering some of the other excellent parts that series 1 has given us. His printing , however, makes up for his lack of new parts to a degree. This is a VERY niche minifig, but it is also fun and a bit cute.

(The plastic quality seems to be a bit worse than the normal minifigs, but it does not detract from the overall look of the fig in the least. The colors look slightly different than the traditional Lego versions due to the plastic differences though.

This minifig is a must for gearheads, saftey nuts and fans of Mythbusters.

Themes to use this fig in: City (maybe)

Usabilty of Doubles: Moderate (Can have a couple in a car or a few floating around an MOC crash test lab)

Overall Score: 7/10 (Good)

author: Alemas
title: Demolition Dummy? Read: Crash-Test Dummy! :P
review:
For Collectable Minifigures, I'll do quick pro-con lists.

So, this is apparently the most rubbish Collectable Minifigure so far. Even if we get printed legs, a printed tile, and a wrench, its lack of clothes and Chinese plastic lets it down.

Pros

  • Wrench
  • Printed tile
  • Printed legs

Cons

  • Lack of clothes
  • Chinese plastic
  • Boring
Overall, the most boring Collectable Minifigure so far.

If you find this review rubbish, it may be because I'm lacking motivation. :P

author: scorpion_156
title: good
review:
always wanted a LEGO crash test dummy even before the collectible figures came out. Finally got one and I love him. Not sure why he has a wrench but ok. License plate can be used for a MO and make a crash test scene for the figure.

The quality is very good minus the leg quality. Printing is excellent, the facial expression seems silly to me and makes me smile. must be the caution sticker on his forehead :P

author: LEGOParadise
title: Argh! I`ve Crashed!
review: The Crash Test Dummy is an OK minifigure. All of it`s parts have already appeared in sets before. The only new thing about it is the printing. Its body is covered in caution symbols and has a half-smiling-half-frowning face. The Crash Test Dummy comes with a spanner and a number plate (proberbly of a crashed car!). Overall, i would give this minifigure 4/5 unless you have some new cars to test!

author: AETerry
title: Demolition Dummy Review
review:
I got this free, so I can't complain at all about the price of this minifigure. I can't say it's the most exciting looking of all the minifigures out. It comes across as more of a dud and only worth getting if you're collecting the minifigures or if you've got ideas on how  you'd want to use this minifigure in a MOC.

 

The print job for the mini's legs, torso and head to show that this is a Demolition or Crash Test Dummy is decent enough. The accessories seem like they're more for giving it something to hold then be just a plain minifigure.

 

In the end I guess he's okay, he may see some long term value as a Collectible and hard to find or get figure as he's from Series 1 of the Collectible Minifigures.

author: JtheMonk
title: Possibly the Worst Ever
review:
I'm surprised at how high the rating for this minifigure is. Not only is this hands down the most boring figure of the series 1 set, it is--as my title suggests--possibly the worst collectible minifigure ever. When series 1 was in stores, I never saw anyone open a package with a Demolition Dummy in it and then not complain that they would rather have gotten a different figure (or spent their money on something else entirely).

The minifigure itself is the same bland black-and-yellow as every other standard minifigure, with nothing truly new or interesting to make it stand out. Its blank, staring facial expression may be the worst part, as it seems to be mocking you about all the other, better series 1 minifigures that could have potentially been in the bag you just opened instead.

In terms of accessories, the wrench has appeared at least a hundred times in other sets and, unless you're doing a car MOC of some kind, it's hard to be too excited by the license plate.

I'm not sure why most other reviewers are so positive about this guy, unless they were planning to drive their lego cars into brick walls (ones made of lego or otherwise) and were happy to have a crash test dummy because they didn't want any of their better minifigures to get hurt.

Maybe you want one to complete the 16-piece set, but that's about it.

author: sideswinger
title: A TERRIBLE figure
review:
So the Demolition Dummy is the eighth figure in the LEGO Minifigures Series 1, and this is a figure I just do not care for or like whatsoever. But before I give my final opinion, let's take a closer look at him!

And he has no hair, so let's start with the head. And he has a pretty boring face in my opinion, with that logo on his forehead, as well as those blank eyes. It just looks pretty mediocre and boring if you ask me. No back head printing either.

Then we have his torso, which is also pretty mediocre. He has those two logos once again, this time on his chest, and he has a little printing on his stomach as well. No back torso printing either, once again.

Then we have his legs, which have a bit of printing on them. They just have four of those circular logos, so not very exciting. I wish they would've done some side leg printing just to spruce him up a bit, but oh well.

Then we have his accessories, which are just as boring as the rest of the figure. He does have two though, which I guess is something. Doesn't help that they're both boring though. He has that black wrench piece, which we've got in so many sets. I guess his other accessory is okay though. It's just that 1x2 tile with "PA7 70" printed on it. I think it's supposed to be a license plate, which to me doesn't make sense for a crash dummy, but maybe I'm just an idiot and doesn't understand.

And as a whole, I am just not a fan of this dude, for so many reasons. First off, his printing and overall design is very boring, and uninteresting. I mean they could've at least done side leg printing. Second, he reminds me a lot of the Series 1 Zombie, where the figure isn't that great, and his two accessories are supposed to make up for it, and fail. I mean, this guys accessories don't make any sense to me, like the Zombie. But while the Zombie was a mediocre figure, don't get me wrong, he's way better than this guy. And finally, he's just an absolutely terrible choice. When I think of interesting categories, "crash dummies" do not come to mind. It just seems like a choice they'd use when they've run out of ideas, which they obviously didn't due to the other 19 non-licensed series' released at the time of this review. It's just incredibly niche.

So if you're thinking about buying some Series 1 off ebay for twenty to fifty bucks, this would be the last one I'd buy, because he's totally my least favorite in the series. However, if you're trying to complete Series 1, you kind of have to buy this guy. I'm not saying he's the plague, I just think LEGO could've done a lot better.

So sorry for my ranting, but thanks for reading!
